message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the classification of Twitter users based on their profile and tweeting behavior information, which involves the use of machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), which deals with the analysis of social networks and their properties. 

The paper also involves the use of natural language processing techniques to analyze the content of tweets, which makes cs.CL (Computation and Language) another likely sub-category. 

Additionally, the paper deals with the identification of spammers and bots on Twitter, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SD (Software Development and Engineering). 

The paper also involves the use of data mining techniques to extract features from Twitter profiles, which makes cs.CY (Computers and Society) another likely sub-category. 

Finally, the paper deals with the evaluation of the proposed approach using metrics such as AUC, precision, and recall, which falls under the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
